contentrichtext.text: {{italictitle}} {{About|the wasp|other things named Zyzzyx or similarly|Zzyzx (disambiguation)}} {{Taxobox | name = ''Zyzzyx'' | regnum = [[Animal]]ia | phylum = [[Arthropod]]a | classis = [[Insect]]a | ordo = [[Hymenoptera]] | subordo = [[Apocrita]] | superfamilia = [[Apoidea]] | familia = [[Crabronidae]] | subfamilia = [[Bembicinae]] | genus = '''''Zyzzyx''''' | genus_authority = Pate, 1937 | species = '''''Z. chilensis''''' | binomial = ''Zyzzyx chilensis'' | binomial_authority = [[Johann Friedrich von Eschscholtz|Eschscholz]], 1822 }} '''Zyzzyx''' is a [[Monospecificity|monospecific]] genus of [[sand wasp]], containing a brightly colored, medium-sized species, '''''Z. chilensis'''''. It is primarily a predator on [[fly|flies]], but has been observed to consume [[Skipper (butterfly)|skippers]].<ref>{{cite journal |author=Howard E. Evans |title=A review of prey choice in bembicine sand wasps (Hymenoptera: Sphecidae) |journal=[[Neotropical Entomology]] |volume=31 |issue=1 |pages=1â€“11 |year=2002 |format=[[Portable Document Format|PDF]] |url=http://www.scielo.br/pdf/ne/v31n1/11172.pdf}}</ref> "''Zyzzyx''" is a replacement name proposed in 1937 by V. S. L. Pate for ''Therapon'', originally described by J. Parker in 1929.<ref>{{cite web |title=''Zyzzyx'' |url=http://research.calacademy.org/files/Departments/ent/sphecidae/Genera_and_species_pdf/Zyzzyx.pdf |format=[[Portable Document Format|PDF]] |publisher=[[California Academy of Sciences]] |accessdate=April 3, 2010}}</ref> ==References== {{reflist}} [[Category:Crabronidae]] [[Category:Biological pest control agents]] [[Category:Onomatopoeias]] {{Wasp-stub}}
